greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum (floor (j^2/n), 1 <= j <= n-1) - floor ((n-1)(n-2)/3), n >= 2.
comment: a(n) = 0 when n = 2, any prime of the form 4k+1 with k >= 1 and any product of these without repetition, e.g. 2x5x17.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
mathematica: Table[Sum[Floor[k^2/n], {k, 1, n - 1}] - Floor[(n - 1)*(n - 2)/3], {n, 2, 100}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 12 2016 *)
results.author: _Christopher Hunt Gribble_, Oct 13 2009
ext: Corrected and enhanced by _Christopher Hunt Gribble_, Dec 01 2009
